alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 5:03PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN LIKELY WITH RISING SNOW LEVELS LATE WEEK... Signals continue to point to a possible atmospheric river event late this week into the weekend including warming temperatures, rising snow levels, and the potential for accumulating snow changing to heavy rain. Some light snow could fall Wednesday before precipitation changes to rain. A short break is possible Thursday before heavy rain starts Thursday night and persists for much of the weekend. Rainfall amounts of 5 to 7 inches are possible from Thursday evening through Sunday for Yakutat, Elfin Cove, and Pelican with Sitka, Port Alexander, Hoonah, Tenakee Springs, and Angoon in line to receive 2 to 4 inches of rain. Snow levels are forecast to rise to 3,000 to 6,000 feet. Heavy rain along with a melting mountain snowpack will increase the risk of minor flooding issues. Please stay tuned to the forecast as it is refined through the week.
